main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified flying objects (UFOs) were reported at Elmendorf AFB, Alaska, in 1953, including a disc-shaped white object, a large red light, and an object with no identification.
interesting points: The reported UFOs were observed by experienced radar operators and visually by qualified observers, indicating significant credibility.
One of the observed objects resembled a metallic balloon, approximately 30-40 feet in diameter, traveling at an estimated speed of 100 mph at an altitude of 30,000 feet.
The large red light remained stationary for approximately five minutes before dimming and disappearing in a northerly direction.
The duration of one sighting was between five to ten minutes, and all persons with knowledge of the sighting were interrogated, yet the flight remains unidentified.
An Air Policeman reported an object operating in a vertical climb at approximately 2,000 feet above the ground with no identification established.
witnesses: experienced radar operators, qualified observers, Air Policeman
